name: places/ChIJ6RN5maxZwokRPJIBI5d0oG8
formattedAddress: 12 E 44th St 7th Floor, New York, NY 10017, USA
adrFormatAddress: 12 E 44th St 7th Floor, New York, NY 10017, USA

originalText.text: When we noticed that our bathroom floor seemed to be sagging we contacted management and they said they could have it fixed on our own time schedule. They sent their crew, as per our request, tore out the old floor,  completely rebuilt the aging infrastructure, and gave us a new, level, tile floor that matched the rest of the room. The workers were very thorough, respectful, and cleaned up after themselves. We are very pleased with the results!

The workers were very thorough, respectful, and cleaned up after themselves. We are very pleased with the results!

originalText.text:
I’ve lived in New York my entire life and this management company has been one of the worst housing management companies I’ve ever had to deal with.

Unresponsive to basic tenant necessities and when they’re approached with complaints on addressing the issue, they seem to lash out as if it’s a personal vendetta against them.

Tenants in the building in which I’m residing have not had heat or hot water consistently throughout the winter. The city has fined them several times and there seems to be no real prioritizing on Brightons end to try and come up with a permanent solution to the issues.

I’m paying 2,000 for a studio that barely meets basic human necessities during the winter months. And several tenants within this building have become idle to the lack of effort Brighton has in regards to fixing these consistent issues.

Truly truly the definition of New York housing market greediness.

originalText.text:
I've been here nearly eight years, and in that time I've seen a lot of positive changes. We have new, bright, flood lights outside and new lights in the lobby, which adds to a feeling of safety/security. Our Super is the best - always available and going above and beyond. Management has gotten so much better about open communication and responding to requests.
No management company is perfect, let's be clear about that. But Brighton, and Serina especially, are working to keep us in the best apartments/homes possible, which is definitely not an easy task in NYC.

originalText.text:
PLEASE AVOID! These people scammed me out of my deposit and blackmailed me saying that if I pursue legal actions I will be added to the New York black list of real estate.

Same group of people also run 2-3 other management companies with similar problems!

All their buildings are crumbling without any maintenance, they run deals to get you in and they won't fix anything in the apartment if you need help.

originalText.text: Leaving with great memories of Brighton Management! Serina and Blerina, the building managers, were incredibly helpful and approachable whenever we had questions. If I return to NY, Brighton will be my top choice for renting again.
